result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian M. Gauthier

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 9:21 AM/Room 301.  Defendant Brian M. Gauthier in court, in custody at the Langlade County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def. requested preliminary hearing, wants to proceed with hearing without counsel. Dep. Travis Krueger, duly sworn on oath, testifies. Def. tells Court he believes he waived P.H. Court confirms nothing filed in case. Def. has no questions. State has no further questions, asks Court to bind over case. Def. has nothing further. Court finds probable cause, binds over for further proceedings. Court advises State to file an Information within 30 days. Court sets Nov. 14, 2022 at 1:30 p.m. for status of counsel hearing. Bond stands.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
No contact with the victim or victims residence.
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

1:09 PM/ RM 301.  Defendant Brian M. Gauthier appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. does wish to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State is in compliance with victims rights. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $3,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and No contact with the victim or victims residence. State notes Def. is currently on a probation hold. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and considers bail bond factors. Court orders a $3,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No contact with the victim or victims residence and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Court finds good cause to go past time limits for P.H. and questions if Def. would like to go past time limits. Def. would like to proceed with P.H.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
